places.description:
Rocky Bay Resorts is a long-standing coastal resort on the KwaZulu-Natal South Coast, situated at Park Rynie near Scottburgh. It is popular with families, anglers, and holidaymakers seeking a beachfront escape with easy access to both nature and amenities. The resort combines a well-equipped caravan and camping park with self-catering log cabins, chalets, and conference facilities.

The location fronts directly onto a stretch of sandy beach and rocky tidal pools, with warm Indian Ocean waters year-round. The resort offers shaded camping sites with electricity, clean ablutions, and braai areas, while accommodation options range from modest log cabins to larger self-catering chalets. A swimming pool, restaurant, and dive centre make it suitable for both relaxation and active pursuits. The surrounding coastal forest and marine environment provide opportunities for birdwatching, fishing, and diving. Its accessibility, range of facilities, and coastal setting make it a versatile base for South Coast holidays.

rates.unit: log cabin (from, per unit per night)

highlight.title: Direct Beach Access
highlight.description: Resort sits right on the South Coast shoreline with sandy beaches and tidal pools at your doorstep.

highlight.title: Gateway to Aliwal Shoal
highlight.description: An on-site dive centre offers charters and gear for exploring one of SA's top-rated reefs.

highlight.title: Range of Stays
highlight.description: Choose between classic camping on grassed stands or stay in fully-equipped self-catering log cabins.

unexpected.title: Coastal Forest Walks
unexpected.description: A small but biodiverse coastal forest borders the resort, home to bushbuck, duiker, and abundant birdlife.

unexpected.title: Winter Sardine Run
unexpected.description: During winter months, the annual Sardine Run can pass directly offshore, creating a world-class wildlife spectacle.

places.meta_title: Rocky Bay Resorts | KZN South Coast Camping & Cabins
places.meta_description: Beachfront resort at Park Rynie, KZN South Coast. Offers camping, log cabins, a pool, on-site dive centre, and direct access to fishing spots and Aliwal Shoal.
places.facilities_summary: Beachfront resort with caravan and camping sites, self-catering cabins, swimming pool, restaurant, bar, on-site dive centre, and conference facilities.
places.ai_summary: Family-friendly beachfront resort on the KZN South Coast with camping, cabins, a pool, trails, and an on-site dive centre for Aliwal Shoal access.
places.raw_data:
Rocky Bay Resorts is located at Park Rynie on the KwaZulu-Natal South Coast, approximately 60 km south of Durban and 10 km from Scottburgh. The resort offers around 170 grassed camping and caravan stands, most with electricity points, and access to modern ablution blocks with hot-water showers, flush toilets, and dishwashing stations. In addition to camping, accommodation includes one-, two-, and three-bedroom self-catering log cabins and chalets, all equipped with kitchens, linen, and private braai facilities.

Core facilities include a freshwater swimming pool, a restaurant and bar, a small camp shop for essentials, laundry services, and a children's playground. The Rocky Bay Trails network offers marked routes for mountain biking and trail running. The on-site Rocky Bay Dive Centre provides charters to the nearby Aliwal Shoal Marine Protected Area. The coastline offers direct beach access for swimming, rock and surf angling, and exploring tidal pools.

The climate is subtropical with hot, humid summers and mild, dry winters. The Indian Ocean is warm year-round. Hazards include strong surf and vervet monkeys. The resort has 24/7 security with a guarded gate. Bookings are per-site or per-unit. Surrounding attractions include Scottburgh (10 km), Crocworld Conservation Centre (12 km), and Oribi Gorge (70 km).
places.experiences_raw: On-site activities: Swimming (pool and sea), rock and surf fishing, snorkelling in tidal pools, diving, mountain biking, and trail running on marked trails. The resort is a hub for Aliwal Shoal dive charters, targeting ragged-tooth sharks (winter), dolphins, and turtles. Family activities centre on the beach, pool, and playground. Nearby activities: Crocworld Conservation Centre (12 km) for reptile and bird viewing. The town of Scottburgh (10 km) has shops, restaurants, and a golf course. Oribi Gorge Nature Reserve (70 km inland) offers hiking, ziplining, and dramatic gorge views. Seasonal experiences: The Sardine Run (June-July) is a major marine event visible from shore. Whale watching is popular from June to November. Birdwatching is excellent year-round in the coastal forest and at nearby Vernon Crookes Nature Reserve (30 km). The wider South Coast offers numerous golf courses, coffee shops, and craft markets in towns like Pennington and Umkomaas.
